problem_text:
Is every locally finite simple group absolutely simple? A group G is said to be absolutely simple if the only composition series of G is {1, G}. For equivalent formulations see (R. E. Phillips, Rend. Sem. Mat. Univ. Padova, 79 (1988), 213–220).
R. Phillips
answer: No, not every (U. Meierfrankenfeld, in: Proc. Int. Conf. Finite and Locally Finite Groups, Istanbul, 1994, Klüwer, 1995, 189–212).
